GeneralInformation.School Vision: A Values-Centred Community where Learning is ignited by Passion, Thinking driven by Innovation and Leading inspired by Service
GeneralInformation.School Mission: To engage the hearts and minds of students to develop them to their full potential enabling them to fulfill their aspirations and contribute as active citizens in society
GeneralInformation.School Philosophy, Culture and Ethos: In our school, we place a premium on the holistic development of students. This is anchored in our strong belief that both academic excellence and character development are pillars of a holistic education. As we develop our students' character, we nurture values and dispositions necessary for excellence in academic pursuits. Whilst we equip our students with knowledge and skills in the academic subjects, we also develop in them the competencies and attitudes to navigate the future. The Jurong West Experience, grounded in Student-Centricity, is premised in our belief that when students have an interest and find enjoyment in what they do, they will do well and find greater motivation to pursue those interests beyond secondary school. The school's value add academic results and strong CCA achievements, particularly in the Uniformed Groups, are testimony to the school's commitment to enable each student to reach his/her full potential. The school has a strong emphasis on Higher Education and Career Guidance. With accurate information on post-secondary pathways students are well placed to make informed choices. Professional development of our staff is a cornerstone in our goal to deliver relevant and engaging lessons and programmes. As a future-oriented and forward looking school, our distinctive LLP and ALP are designed with the future and national initiatives such as smart nation in mind. These programmes offer students an integrative and immersive educational experience beyond a typical curriculum.
GeneralInformation.Type of School: GOVERNMENT SCHOOL / CO-ED SCHOOL / SINGLE SESSION

Clubs & Societies: Audio Video And Information Technology Club

School Distinctive Programmes.Aesthetics: Harnessing Technology, Communication and the Visual Arts in Authentic Contexts

SpecialProgrammes.Special Student Development Programmes O: Enhanced Art Programme(EAP)-Provides opportunities for talented Art students to develop their talent at higher levels; Learning for Life Programme(LLP)-Community and Youth Leadership that focuses on equipping students with values and life skills by initiating and leading community projects; Applied Learning Programme(ALP)-Equips students with ICT, communication and design skills to solve real life issues; Student Work Attachment Programme(SWAP)-Provides greater exposure to the world of work and an understanding of the type of knowledge and skills needed for industries; Student Leadership Programme; Talent Development Programme(English,Mathematics,Science)-To deepen students' learning and stretch thinking in the disciplines; Shanghai-Singapore Overseas Student Exchange Programme; Eligible N(A) and N(T) students are given the flexibility to take some subjects at a higher level starting from Sec 1, based on their PSLE results. Beyond the start of Sec 1, students can also do so if they do well in those subjects.
